info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 26 at 4:30PM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Klamath County through 500 PM PDT... At 427 PM PDT, trained weather spotters reported a strong thunderstorm 11 miles south of Chemult, or 17 miles northeast of Crater Lake. This storm was nearly stationary or moving slowly to the south southeast. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of central Klamath County, but will affect areas near the intersection of State Route 138 and Highway 97 and from mile marker 208 to 224 along Highway 97. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
